Function Documentation

cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_access ( cache_entry_t *  pentry,
fsal_accessflags_t  access_type,
hash_table_t *  ht,
cache_inode_client_t *  pclient,
fsal_op_context_t *  pcontext,
cache_inode_status_t *  pstatus 
)

cache_inode_access: checks for an entry accessibility.

Checks for an entry accessibility.

Parameters:
pentry [IN] entry pointer for the fs object to be checked.
access_type [IN] flags used to describe the kind of access to be checked.
ht [INOUT] hash table used for the cache.
pclient [INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
pcontext [IN] FSAL credentials
pstatus [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry

cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_access_sw ( cache_entry_t *  pentry,
fsal_accessflags_t  access_type,

)

cache_inode_access: checks for an entry accessibility.

Checks for an entry accessibility.

Parameters:
pentry [IN] entry pointer for the fs object to be checked.
access_type [IN] flags used to describe the kind of access to be checked.
ht [INOUT] hash table used for the cache.
pclient [INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
pcontext [IN] FSAL context
pstatus [OUT] returned status.
use_mutex [IN] a flag to tell if mutex are to be used or not.
Returns:
CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry
any other values show an unauthorized access.
